attributes.name: description

attributes.name: orientation

attributes.name: view-from

attributes.name: ellipsoid

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: `optional` A options.label to associate with this entity.

attributes.name: model
attributes.description: `optional` A model to associate with this entity.

attributes.name: tileset
attributes.description: `optional` A tileset to associate with this entity.

attributes.name: path
attributes.description: `optional` A path to associate with this entity.

attributes.name: plane
attributes.description: `optional` A plane to associate with this entity.

attributes.name: point
attributes.description: `optional` A point to associate with this entity.

attributes.name: polygon
attributes.description: `optional` A polygon to associate with this entity.

attributes.name: polyline
attributes.description: `optional` A polyline to associate with this entity.

attributes.name: properties
attributes.description: `optional` Arbitrary properties to associate with this entity.

attributes.name: polyline-volume
attributes.description: `optional` A polylineVolume to associate with this entity.

attributes.name: rectangle

attributes.name: wall

tags.name: vc-layer-imagery
tags.description: Loading an image layer is equivalent to initializing a `Cesium.ImageryLayer` instance.

attributes.name: sort-order
attributes.description: `optional` Specify the relative order of the layers.

attributes.name: imagery-provider
attributes.description: `optional` The imagery provider to use.

attributes.name: rectangle
attributes.description: `optional` The rectangle of the layer. This rectangle can limit the visible portion of the imagery provider.

attributes.name: alpha
attributes.description: `optional` The alpha blending value of this layer, from 0.0 to 1.0.

attributes.name: night-alpha
attributes.description: `optional` The alpha blending value of this layer on the night side of the globe, from 0.0 to 1.0.

attributes.name: day-alpha
attributes.description: `optional` The alpha blending value of this layer on the day side of the globe, from 0.0 to 1.0.

attributes.name: brightness
attributes.description: `optional` The brightness of this layer. 1.0 uses the unmodified imagery color. Less than 1.0 makes the imagery darker while greater than 1.0 makes it brighter.

attributes.name: contrast
attributes.description: `optional` The contrast of this layer. 1.0 uses the unmodified imagery color. Less than 1.0 reduces the contrast while greater than 1.0 increases it.

attributes.name: hue
attributes.description: `optional` The hue of this layer. 0.0 uses the unmodified imagery color. This can either be a simple number or a function with the signature function(frameState, layer, x, y, level).

attributes.name: saturation
attributes.description: `optional` The saturation of this layer. 1.0 uses the unmodified imagery color. Less than 1.0 reduces the saturation while greater than 1.0 increases it.

attributes.name: gamma
attributes.description: `optional`The gamma correction to apply to this layer. 1.0 uses the unmodified imagery color. This can either be a simple number or a function with the signature function(frameState, layer, x, y, level). The function is passed the current frame state, this layer, and the x, y, and level coordinates of the imagery tile for which the gamma is required, and it is expected to return the gamma value to use for the tile. The function is executed for every frame and for every tile, so it must be fast.

attributes.name: split-direction
attributes.description: `optional`The ImagerySplitDirection split to apply to this layer.  **LEFT: -1, NONE: 0, RIGHT: 1**

attributes.name: minification-filter
attributes.description: `optional` The texture minification filter to apply to this layer. Possible values are TextureMinificationFilter.LINEAR and TextureMinificationFilter.NEAREST. **NEAREST: 9728, LINEAR: 9729, NEAREST_MIPMAP_NEAREST: 9984, LINEAR_MIPMAP_NEAREST: 9985, NEAREST_MIPMAP_LINEAR: 9986, NEAREST_MIPMAP_NEAREST: 9984**

attributes.name: magnification-filter
attributes.description: `optional` The texture minification filter to apply to this layer. Possible values are TextureMagnificationFilter.LINEAR and TextureMagnificationFilter.NEAREST. **NEAREST: 9728, LINEAR: 9729**

attributes.name: show
attributes.description: `optional` True if the layer is shown; otherwise, false.

attributes.name: maximum-anisotropy
attributes.description: `optional` The maximum anisotropy level to use for texture filtering. If this parameter is not specified, the maximum anisotropy supported by the WebGL stack will be used. Larger values make the imagery look better in horizon views.

attributes.name: minimum-terrain-level
attributes.description: `optional`The minimum terrain level-of-detail at which to show this imagery layer, or undefined to show it at all levels. Level zero is the least-detailed level.

attributes.name: maximum-terrain-level
attributes.description: `optional`The maximum terrain level-of-detail at which to show this imagery layer, or undefined to show it at all levels. Level zero is the least-detailed level.

attributes.name: cutout-rectangle
attributes.description: `optional` Cartographic rectangle for cutting out a portion of this ImageryLayer.

attributes.name: color-to-alpha
attributes.description: `optional` Color to be used as alpha.

attributes.name: color-to-alpha-threshold
attributes.description: `optional` Threshold for color-to-alpha.

events.name: before-load
events.description: Triggers before the object is loaded.

events.name: ready
events.description: Triggers when the object is loaded.

events.name: destroyed
events.description: Triggers when the object is destroyed.

events.name: update:imagery-provider
events.description: Triggers when imageryProvider is updated.

tags.name: vc-viewer
tags.description: The basic component for building a `Cesium` application, which is essentially a DOM node initialized by `Cesium.Viewer`, which is used to mount other DOM nodes or subcomponents.The `Cesium` and `Viewer` instances returned from the `ready` event of `vc-viewer` are used for Cesium API development. You can also get the `creatingPromise` object of the component through the `ref` template reference to get the Viewer instance.

attributes.name: camera
attributes.description: `optional` Scene camera position. Default positioning to China worldwide.

attributes.name: show-credit
attributes.description: `optional` Specify whether to display the default Logo and loading data copyright information.

attributes.name: auto-sort-imagery-layers
attributes.description: `optional` Specify whether to automatically sort imageLayers according to the layer's `sortOrder` property when adding imagelayer.

attributes.name: remove-cesium-script
attributes.description: `optional` Specify whether to remove the CesiumJS script tag when `vc-viewer` is destroyed.

attributes.name: enable-mouse-event
attributes.description: `optional` Specifiy whether to trigger mouse events.

attributes.name: skeleton
attributes.description: `optional` Specify whether to show the skeleton background during `vc-viewer` initialization.

attributes.name: touch-hold-arg
attributes.description: `optional` Specify the time delay for `vc-viewer` to respond to press events on touchscreens.

attributes.name: t-zcode
attributes.description: `optional` The time zone code used for timeline date formatting. By default, it is formatted as local time. If you want to display it as UTC universal time, set `UTCoffset` to `new Date().getTimezoneOffset()`

attributes.name: u-t-coffset
attributes.description: `optional` The time difference (minutes) between local time and UTC time.

attributes.name: access-token
attributes.description: `optional` Specify the default [Cesium ion](https://cesium.com/ion/) access token.

attributes.name: cesium-path
attributes.description: `optional` Specify the web service address of the CesiumJS library used to initialize the `vc-viewer` component.

attributes.name: animation
attributes.description: `optional` If set to false, the Animation widget will not be created.

attributes.name: base-layer-picker
attributes.description: `optional` If set to false, the BaseLayerPicker widget will not be created.

attributes.name: fullscreen-button
attributes.description: `optional` If set to false, the FullscreenButton widget will not be created.

attributes.name: vr-button
attributes.description: `optional` If set to true, the VRButton widget will be created.

attributes.name: geocoder
attributes.description: `optional` If set to false, the Geocoder widget will not be created.

attributes.name: home-button
attributes.description: `optional` If set to false, the HomeButton widget will not be created.

attributes.name: info-box
attributes.description: `optional` If set to false, the InfoBox widget will not be created.

attributes.name: scene-mode-picker
attributes.description: `optional` If set to false, the SceneModePicker widget will not be created.

attributes.name: selection-indicator
attributes.description: `optional` If set to false, the SelectionIndicator widget will not be created.

attributes.name: timeline
attributes.description: `optional` If set to false, the Timeline widget will not be created.

attributes.name: navigation-help-button
attributes.description: `optional` If set to false, the navigation help button will not be created.

attributes.name: navigation-instructions-initially-visible
attributes.description: `optional` True if the navigation instructions should initially be visible, or false if the should not be shown until the user explicitly clicks the button.

attributes.name: scene3-d-only
attributes.description: `optional` When true, each geometry instance will only be rendered in 3D to save GPU memory.

attributes.name: should-animate
attributes.description: `optional` true if the clock should attempt to advance simulation time by default, false otherwise.

attributes.name: clock-view-model
attributes.description: `optional` The clock view model to use to control current time.

attributes.name: selected-imagery-provider-view-model
attributes.description: `optional` The view model for the current base imagery layer, if not supplied the first available base layer is used. This value is only valid if `baseLayerPicker` is set to true.

attributes.name: terrain-provider-view-models
attributes.description: `optional` The array of ProviderViewModels to be selectable from the BaseLayerPicker. This value is only valid if `baseLayerPicker` is set to true.

attributes.name: imagery-provider
attributes.description: `optional` The imagery provider to use. This value is only valid if `baseLayerPicker` is set to false.`vue-cesium` has replaced the default one with `NaturalEarthII` that comes with Cesium resources.

attributes.name: terrain-provider
attributes.description: `optional` The terrain provider to use

attributes.name: sky-box
attributes.description: `optional` The skybox used to render the stars. When undefined, the default stars are used. If set to false, no skyBox, Sun, or Moon will be added.

attributes.name: sky-atmosphere
attributes.description: `optional` Blue sky, and the glow around the Earth's limb. Set to false to turn it off.

attributes.name: fullscreen-element
attributes.description: `optional` The element or id to be placed into fullscreen mode when the full screen button is pressed.

attributes.name: use-default-render-loop
attributes.description: `optional` True if this widget should control the render loop, false otherwise.

attributes.name: target-frame-rate
attributes.description: `optional` The target frame rate when using the default render loop.

attributes.name: show-render-loop-errors
attributes.description: `optional` If true, this widget will automatically display an HTML panel to the user containing the error, if a render loop error occurs.

attributes.name: use-browser-recommended-resolution
attributes.description: `optional` If true, render at the browser's recommended resolution and ignore window.devicePixelRatio.

attributes.name: automatically-track-data-source-clocks
attributes.description: `optional` If true, this widget will automatically track the clock settings of newly added DataSources, updating if the DataSource's clock changes. Set this to false if you want to configure the clock independently.

attributes.name: context-options
attributes.description: `optional` Context and WebGL creation properties corresponding to options passed to Scene.

attributes.name: scene-mode
attributes.description: `optional` The initial scene mode. **COLUMBUS_VIEW: 1, SCENE2D: 2, SCENE3D: 3**

attributes.name: map-projection
attributes.description: `optional` The map projection to use in 2D and Columbus View modes.

attributes.name: globe
attributes.description: `optional` The globe to use in the scene. If set to false, no globe will be added.

attributes.name: order-independent-translucency
attributes.description: `optional` If true and the configuration supports it, use order independent translucency.

attributes.name: credit-container
attributes.description: `optional` The DOM element or ID that will contain the CreditDisplay. If not specified, the credits are added to the bottom of the widget itself.

attributes.name: credit-viewport
attributes.description: `optional` The DOM element or ID that will contain the credit pop up created by the CreditDisplay. If not specified, it will appear over the widget itself.

attributes.name: data-sources
attributes.description: `optional`  The collection of data sources visualized by the widget. If this parameter is provided, the instance is assumed to be owned by the caller and will not be destroyed when the viewer is destroyed.

attributes.name: terrain-exaggeration
attributes.description: `optional` A scalar used to exaggerate the terrain. Note that terrain exaggeration will not modify any other primitive as they are positioned relative to the ellipsoid.

attributes.name: shadows
attributes.description: `optional` Determines if shadows are cast by the sun.

attributes.name: terrain-shadows
attributes.description: `optional` Determines if the terrain casts or receives shadows from the sun.**DISABLED: 0, ENABLED: 1, CAST_ONLY: 2, RECEIVE_ONLY: 3**

attributes.name: map-mode2-d
attributes.description: `optional` Determines if the 2D map is rotatable or can be scrolled infinitely in the horizontal direction.**ROTATE: 0, INFINITE_SCROLL: 1**

attributes.name: projection-picker
attributes.description: `optional` If set to true, the ProjectionPicker widget will be created.

attributes.name: request-render-mode
attributes.description: `optional` If true, rendering a frame will only occur when needed as determined by changes within the scene. Enabling reduces the CPU/GPU usage of your application and uses less battery on mobile, but requires using Scene#requestRender to render a new frame explicitly in this mode. This will be necessary in many cases after making changes to the scene in other parts of the API. See Improving Performance with Explicit Rendering.

attributes.name: maximum-render-time-change
attributes.description: `optional` If requestRenderMode is true, this value defines the maximum change in simulation time allowed before a render is requested. See Improving Performance with Explicit Rendering.

events.name: cesium-ready
events.description: Triggers when CesiumJS is successfully loaded.

events.name: before-load
events.description: Triggers before vc-viewer is loaded.

events.name: ready
events.description: Triggers when vc-viewer is successfully loaded.

events.name: destroyed
events.description: Triggers when vc-viewer is destroyed.

events.name: viewer-widget-resized
events.description: Triggers when a component changes on vc-viewer.

events.name: touch-end
events.description: Triggers when the vc-viewer touch ends..

events.name: selected-entity-changed
events.description: Triggers when the selected entity changes.

events.name: tracked-entity-changed
events.description: Triggers when the tracked entity changes.

events.name: layer-added
events.description: Triggers when a layer is added to the collection. Event handlers are passed the layer that was added and the index at which it was added.

events.name: layer-moved
events.description: Triggers when a layer changes position in the collection. Event handlers are passed the layer that was moved, its new index after the move, and its old index prior to the move.

events.name: layer-removed
events.description: Triggers when a layer is removed from the collection. Event handlers are passed the layer that was removed and the index from which it was removed.

events.name: layer-shown-or-hidden
events.description: Triggers when a layer is shown or hidden by setting the ImageryLayer#show property. Event handlers are passed a reference to this layer, the index of the layer in the collection, and a flag that is true if the layer is now shown or false if it is now hidden.

events.name: data-source-added
events.description: Triggers when a data source is added to the collection. Event handlers are passed the data source that was added.

events.name: data-source-moved
events.description: Triggers when a data source changes position in the collection. Event handlers are passed the data source that was moved, its new index after the move, and its old index prior to the move.

events.name: data-source-removed
events.description: Triggers when a data source is removed from the collection. Event handlers are passed the data source that was removed.

events.name: collection-changed
events.description: Triggers when when entities are added or removed from the collection. The generated event is a EntityCollection.collectionChangedEventCallback.

events.name: morph-complete
events.description: Triggers at the completion of a scene transition.

events.name: morph-start
events.description: Triggers at the beginning of a scene transition.

events.name: post-render
events.description: Triggers immediately after the scene is rendered. Subscribers to the event receive the Scene instance as the first parameter and the current time as the second parameter.

events.name: pre-render
events.description: Triggers after the scene is updated and immediately before the scene is rendered. Subscribers to the event receive the Scene instance as the first parameter and the current time as the second parameter.

events.name: post-update
events.description: Triggers immediately after the scene is updated and before the scene is rendered. Subscribers to the event receive the Scene instance as the first parameter and the current time as the second parameter.

events.name: pre-update
events.description: Triggers before the scene is updated or rendered. Subscribers to the event receive the Scene instance as the first parameter and the current time as the second parameter.

events.name: render-error
events.description: Triggers when an error is thrown inside the render function. The Scene instance and the thrown error are the only two parameters passed to the event handler. By default, errors are not rethrown after this event is raised, but that can be changed by setting the rethrowRenderErrors property.

events.name: terrain-provider-changed
events.description: Triggers when the terrain provider is changed.

events.name: changed
events.description: Triggers when the camera has changed by percentageChanged.

events.name: move-end
events.description: Triggers when the camera has stopped moving.

events.name: move-start
events.description: Triggers when the camera starts to move.

events.name: on-stop
events.description: Triggers when Clock#stopTime is reached.

events.name: on-tick
events.description: Triggers when Clock#tick is called.

events.name: error-event
events.description: Triggers when the terrain provider encounters an asynchronous error. By subscribing to the event, you will be notified of the error and can potentially recover from it. Event listeners are passed an instance of TileProviderError.

events.name: camera-clicked
events.description: Triggers when the user clicks the camera icon.

events.name: close-clicked
events.description: Triggers when the user closes the info box.

events.name: left-click
events.description: Triggers when the mouse left button clicked.

events.name: left-double-click
events.description: Triggered when the mouse left button double clicked.

events.name: left-down
events.description: Triggered when the mouse left button down.

events.name: left-up
events.description: Triggered when the mouse left button up.

events.name: middle-click
events.description: Triggers when the mouse middle button clicked.

events.name: middle-down
events.description: Triggers when the mouse middle button down.

events.name: middle-up
events.description: Triggers when the mouse middle button up.

events.name: mouse-move
events.description: Triggers when the mouse move.

events.name: pinch-end
events.description: Triggers when end of a two-finger on a touch surface.

events.name: pinch-move
events.description: Triggers when a change of a two-finger on a touch surface.

events.name: pinch-start
events.description: Triggers when the start of a two-finger on a touch surface.

events.name: right-click
events.description: Triggers when the mouse right click.

events.name: right-down
events.description: Triggers when the mouse right button down.

events.name: right-up
events.description: Triggers when the mouse right button up.

events.name: wheel
events.description: Triggers when the mouse wheel.

events.name: imagery-layers-updated-event
events.description: Triggers when an imagery layer is added, shown, hidden, moved, or removed.

events.name: tile-load-progress-event
events.description: Triggers when the length of the tile load queue has changed since the last render frame. When the load queue is empty, all terrain and imagery for the current view have been loaded. The event passes the new length of the tile load queue.

attributes.name: positions
attributes.description: `required` An array of Cartesian3 defining the polyline's points. Heights above the ellipsoid will be ignored.

attributes.name: width
attributes.description: `optional` The screen space width in pixels.

attributes.name: granularity
attributes.description: `optional` The distance interval in meters used for interpolating options.points. Defaults to 9999.0 meters. Zero indicates no interpolation.

attributes.name: loop
attributes.description: `optional` Whether during geometry creation a line segment will be added between the last and first line positions to make this Polyline a loop.

attributes.name: arc-type
attributes.description: `optional` The type of line the polyline segments must follow. Valid options are ArcType.GEODESIC and ArcType.RHUMB. **NONE: 0, GEODESIC: 1, RHUMB: 2**

tags.name: vc-graphics-billboard
tags.description: Loading a billboard graphic. It is equivalent to initializing a `Cesium.BillboardGraphics` instance.

attributes.name: show
attributes.description: `optional` A boolean Property specifying the visibility of the billboard.

attributes.name: image
attributes.description: `optional` A Property specifying the Image, URI, or Canvas to use for the billboard.

attributes.name: scale
attributes.description: `optional` A numeric Property specifying the scale to apply to the image size.

attributes.name: pixel-offset
attributes.description: `optional` A VcCartesian2 Property specifying the pixel offset.

attributes.name: eye-offset
attributes.description: `optional` A VcPosition Property specifying the eye offset.

attributes.name: horizontal-origin
attributes.description: `optional` A Property specifying the HorizontalOrigin. **CENTER: 0, LEFT: 1, RIGHT: -1**

attributes.name: vertical-origin
attributes.description: `optional` A Property specifying the VerticalOrigin. **CENTER: 0, BOTTOM: 1, BASELINE: 2, TOP: -1**

attributes.name: height-reference
attributes.description: `optional` A Property specifying what the height is relative to. **NONE: 0, CLAMP_TO_GROUND: 1, RELATIVE_TO_GROUND: 2**

attributes.name: color
attributes.description: `optional` A Property specifying the tint Color of the image.

attributes.name: rotation
attributes.description: `optional` A numeric Property specifying the rotation about the alignedAxis.

attributes.name: aligned-axis
attributes.description: `optional` A VcPosition Property specifying the unit vector axis of rotation.

attributes.name: size-in-meters
attributes.description: `optional` A boolean Property specifying whether this billboard's size should be measured in meters.

attributes.name: width
attributes.description: `optional` A numeric Property specifying the width of the billboard in pixels, overriding the native size.

attributes.name: height
attributes.description: `optional` A numeric Property specifying the height of the billboard in pixels, overriding the native size.

attributes.name: scale-by-distance
attributes.description: `optional` A VcNearFarScalar Property used to scale the point based on distance from the camera.

attributes.name: translucency-by-distance
attributes.description: `optional` A VcNearFarScalar Property used to set translucency based on distance from the camera.

attributes.name: pixel-offset-scale-by-distance
attributes.description: `optional` A VcNearFarScalar Property used to set pixelOffset based on distance from the camera.

attributes.name: image-sub-region
attributes.description: `optional` A Property specifying a BoundingRectangle that defines a sub-region of the image to use for the billboard, rather than the entire image, measured in pixels from the bottom-left.

attributes.name: distance-display-condition
attributes.description: `optional` A Property specifying at what distance from the camera that this billboard will be displayed.

attributes.name: disable-depth-test-distance
attributes.description: `optional` A Property specifying the distance from the camera at which to disable the depth test to.

tags.name: vc-graphics-model
tags.description: Loading the model graphic. It is equivalent to initializing a `Cesium.ModelGraphics` instance.

attributes.name: show
attributes.description: `optional` A boolean Property specifying the visibility of the model.

attributes.name: uri
attributes.description: `optional` A string or Resource Property specifying the URI of the glTF asset.

attributes.name: scale
attributes.description: `optional` A numeric Property specifying a uniform linear scale.

attributes.name: minimum-pixel-size
attributes.description: `optional` A numeric Property specifying the approximate minimum pixel size of the model regardless of zoom.

attributes.name: maximum-scale
attributes.description: `optional` The maximum scale size of a model. An upper limit for minimumPixelSize.

attributes.name: incrementally-load-textures
attributes.description: `optional` Determine if textures may continue to stream in after the model is loaded.

attributes.name: run-animations
attributes.description: `optional` A boolean Property specifying if glTF animations specified in the model should be started.

attributes.name: clamp-animations
attributes.description: `optional` A boolean Property specifying if glTF animations should hold the last pose for time durations with no keyframes.

attributes.name: shadows
attributes.description: `optional` An enum Property specifying whether the model casts or receives shadows from each light source. **DISABLED: 0, ENABLED: 1, CAST_ONLY: 2, RECEIVE_ONLY: 3**

attributes.name: height-reference
attributes.description: `optional` A Property specifying what the height is relative to. **NONE: 0, CLAMP_TO_GROUND: 1, RELATIVE_TO_GROUND: 2**

attributes.name: silhouette-color
attributes.description: `optional` A Property specifying the Color of the silhouette.

attributes.name: silhouette-size
attributes.description: `optional` A numeric Property specifying the size of the silhouette in pixels.

attributes.name: color
attributes.description: `optional` A Property specifying the Color that blends with the model's rendered color.

attributes.name: color-blend-mode
attributes.description: `optional` An enum Property specifying how the color blends with the model. **HIGHLIGHT: 0, REPLACE: 1, MIX: 2**

attributes.name: color-blend-amount
attributes.description: `optional` A numeric Property specifying the color strength when the colorBlendMode is MIX. A value of 0.0 results in the model's rendered color while a value of 1.0 results in a solid color, with any value in-between resulting in a mix of the two.

attributes.name: image-based-lighting-factor
attributes.description: `optional` A property specifying the contribution from diffuse and specular image-based lighting.

attributes.name: light-color
attributes.description: `optional` A property specifying the light color to use when shading the model. The default sun light color will be used when undefined.

attributes.name: distance-display-condition
attributes.description: `optional` A NearFarScalar Property used to set pixelOffset based on distance from the camera.A Property specifying at what distance from the camera that this model will be displayed.

attributes.name: node-transformations
attributes.description: `optional` An object, where keys are names of nodes, and values are TranslationRotationScale Properties describing the transformation to apply to that node. The transformation is applied after the node's existing transformation as specified in the glTF, and does not replace the node's existing transformation.

attributes.name: articulations
attributes.description: `optional` An object, where keys are composed of an articulation name, a single space, and a stage name, and the values are numeric properties.

attributes.name: clipping-planes
attributes.description: `optional` A property specifying the ClippingPlaneCollection used to selectively disable rendering the model.

attributes.description: `optional` Determines how the clock should behave when Clock#startTime or Clock#stopTime is reached.

attributes.description: `optional` Determines if calls to Clock#tick are frame dependent or system clock dependent.

attributes.name: can-animate

attributes.name: multiplier
attributes.description: `optional` Determines how much time advances when Clock#tick is called, negative values allow for advancing backwards.

attributes.name: default-interval

attributes.name: options
attributes.description: `optional` Specify optional parameters.

events.description: Triggers before the cesiumObject is loaded.

tags.name: vc-post-process-stage
tags.description: Loading post-processing effects. It is equivalent to initializing a `Cesium.PostProcessStage` instance.

attributes.name: fragment-shader
attributes.description: `required` The fragment shader to use. The default sampler2D uniforms are colorTexture and depthTexture. The color texture is the output of rendering the scene or the previous stage. The depth texture is the output from rendering the scene. The shader should contain one or both uniforms. There is also a vec2 varying named v_textureCoordinates that can be used to sample the textures.

attributes.name: uniforms
attributes.description: `optional` An object whose properties will be used to set the shaders uniforms. The properties can be constant values or a function. A constant value can also be a URI, data URI, or HTML element to use as a texture.

attributes.name: texture-scale
attributes.description: `optional` A number in the range (0.0, 1.0] used to scale the texture dimensions. A scale of 1.0 will render this post-process stage to a texture the size of the viewport.

attributes.name: force-power-of-two
attributes.description: `optional` Whether or not to force the texture dimensions to be both equal powers of two. The power of two will be the next power of two of the minimum of the dimensions.

attributes.name: sample-mode
attributes.description: `optional` How to sample the input color texture. **{NEAREST: 0, LINEAR: 1}**

attributes.name: pixel-format
attributes.description: `optional` The color pixel format of the output texture.

attributes.name: pixel-datatype
attributes.description: `optional` The pixel data type of the output texture.

attributes.name: clear-color
attributes.description: `optional` The color to clear the output texture to.

attributes.name: scissor-rectangle
attributes.description: `optional` The rectangle to use for the scissor test.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: `optional` The unique name of this post-process stage for reference by other stages in a composite. If a name is not supplied, a GUID will be generated.

events.name: before-load
events.description: Triggers before the cesiumObject is loaded.

events.name: ready
events.description: Triggers when the cesiumObject is successfully loaded.

events.name: destroyed
events.description: Triggers when the cesiumObject is destroyed.

tags.name: vc-billboard
tags.description: Loading a viewport-aligned image positioned in the 3D scene. It is equivalent to initializing a `Cesium.Billboard` instance.

attributes.name: aligned-axis
attributes.description: `optional` The aligned axis in world space. The aligned axis is the unit vector that the billboard up vector points towards. The default is the zero vector, which means the billboard is aligned to the screen up vector.

attributes.name: color
attributes.description: `optional` The color that is multiplied with the billboard's texture.

attributes.name: disable-depth-test-distance
attributes.description: `optional` The distance from the camera at which to disable the depth test to, for example, prevent clipping against terrain. When set to zero, the depth test is always applied. When set to Number.POSITIVE_INFINITY, the depth test is never applied.

attributes.name: distance-display-condition
attributes.description: `optional` The condition specifying at what distance from the camera that this billboard will be displayed.

attributes.name: eye-offset
attributes.description: `optional` The 3D Cartesian offset applied to this billboard in eye coordinates.

attributes.name: height
attributes.description: `optional` The height for the billboard. If undefined, the image height will be used.

attributes.name: height-reference
attributes.description: `optional` The height reference of this billboard. **NONE: 0, CLAMP_TO_GROUND: 1, RELATIVE_TO_GROUND: 2**

attributes.name: horizontal-origin
attributes.description: `optional` The horizontal origin of this billboard, which determines if the billboard is to the left, center, or right of its anchor position. **CENTER: 0, LEFT: 1, RIGHT: -1**

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: `optional` The user-defined object returned when the billboard is picked.

attributes.name: image
attributes.description: `optional` The image to be used for this billboard. If a texture has already been created for the given image, the existing texture is used.

attributes.name: pixel-offset
attributes.description: `optional` The pixel offset in screen space from the origin of this billboard.

attributes.name: pixel-offset-scale-by-distance
attributes.description: `optional` The near and far pixel offset scaling properties of a Billboard based on the billboard's distance from the camera.

attributes.name: position
attributes.description: `optional` The position of this billboard.

attributes.name: rotation
attributes.description: `optional` The rotation angle in radians.

attributes.name: scale
attributes.description: `optional`  The uniform scale that is multiplied with the billboard's image size in pixels.

attributes.name: scale-by-distance
attributes.description: `optional` The near and far scaling properties of a Billboard based on the billboard's distance from the camera.

attributes.name: show
attributes.description: `optional` Determines if this billboard will be shown. Use this to hide or show a billboard, instead of removing it and re-adding it to the collection.

attributes.name: size-in-meters
attributes.description: `optional` Determines if the billboard size is in meters or pixels. true to size the billboard in meters; otherwise, the size is in pixels.

attributes.name: translucency-by-distance
attributes.description: `optional` The near and far translucency properties of a Billboard based on the billboard's distance from the camera.

attributes.name: vertical-origin
attributes.description: `optional` The vertical origin of this billboard, which determines if the billboard is to the above, below, or at the center of its anchor position. **CENTER: 0, BOTTOM: 1, BASELINE: 2, TOP: -1**

attributes.name: width
attributes.description: `optional` The width for the billboard. If undefined, the image width will be used.

attributes.name: enable-mouse-event
attributes.description: `optional` Specify whether the mouse event takes effect.

tags.name: vc-collection-billboard
tags.description: Loading a renderable collection of billboards. It is equivalent to initializing a `Cesium.BillboardCollection` instance. It is recommended to use the `billboards` prop to express when rendering massive billboards.

attributes.name: model-matrix
attributes.description: `optional` The 4x4 transformation matrix that transforms each billboard from model to world coordinates.

attributes.name: debug-show-bounding-volume
attributes.description: `optional` For debugging only. Determines if this primitive's commands' bounding spheres are shown.

attributes.name: scene
attributes.description: `optional` Must be passed in for billboards that use the height reference property or will be depth tested against the globe.

attributes.name: blend-option
attributes.description: `optional` The billboard blending option. The default is used for rendering both opaque and translucent billboards. However, if either all of the billboards are completely opaque or all are completely translucent, setting the technique to BlendOption.OPAQUE or BlendOption.TRANSLUCENT can improve performance by up to 2x. **OPAQUE: 0, TRANSLUCENT: 1, OPAQUE_AND_TRANSLUCENT: 2**

attributes.name: show
attributes.description: `optional` Determines if the primitives in the collection will be shown.

attributes.name: billboards
attributes.description: `optional` Specify an array of billboard collections. The structure of the array object is the same as the attribute of the `vc-billboard` component.

attributes.name: enable-mouse-event
attributes.description: `optional` Specify whether the mouse event takes effect.

tags.description: Loading a cloud primitive collection is equivalent to initializing a `Cesium.CloudCollection` instance. When rendering multiple cloud primitives, it is recommended to use the `clouds` attribute.

attributes.name: show
attributes.description: `optional` Whether to display the clouds.

attributes.name: noise-detail
attributes.description: `optional` Desired amount of detail in the noise texture.

attributes.name: noise-offset
attributes.description: `optional` Desired translation of data in noise texture.

attributes.name: debug-billboards
attributes.description: `optional` For debugging only. Determines if the billboards are rendered with an opaque color.

attributes.name: debug-ellipsoids
attributes.description: `optional` For debugging only. Determines if the clouds will be rendered as opaque ellipsoids.

attributes.name: clouds
attributes.description: `optional` Specifies an array of cumulus collections. The array object structure is the same as the `vc-cumulus-cloud` component properties.

tags.name: vc-cumulus-cloud
tags.description: Loading cumulus cloud. It is equivalent to initializing a `Cesium.CumulusCloud` instance.

attributes.name: brightness
attributes.description: `optional` Specify the brightness of the cloud. This can be used to give clouds a darker, grayer appearance.

attributes.name: color
attributes.description: `optional` Specify the color of the cloud.

attributes.name: maximum-size
attributes.description: `optional` Specify the maximum size of the cumulus cloud rendered on the billboard. This defines a maximum ellipsoid volume that the cloud can appear in. Rather than guaranteeing a specific size, this specifies a boundary for the cloud to appear in, and changing it can affect the shape of the cloud.

attributes.name: position
attributes.description: `optional` Specify the Cartesian position of this cumulus cloud.

attributes.name: scale
attributes.description: `optional` Specify the scale of the cumulus cloud billboard in meters. The scale property will affect the size of the billboard, but not the cloud's actual appearance.

attributes.name: show
attributes.description: `optional` Determines if this cumulus cloud will be shown. Use this to hide or show a cloud, instead of removing it and re-adding it to the collection.

attributes.name: slice
attributes.description: `optional` If slice is set to a negative number, the cloud will not render a cross-section. Instead, it will render the outside of the ellipsoid that is visible. For clouds with small values of `maximumSize.z`, this can produce good-looking results, but for larger clouds, this can result in a cloud that is undesirably warped to the ellipsoid volume.

attributes.name: background-color

attributes.name: background-padding
attributes.description: `optional` The background padding, in pixels, of this label.

attributes.description: `optional` The distance from the camera at which to disable the depth test to, for example, prevent clipping against terrain. When set to zero, the depth test is always applied. When set to Number.POSITIVE_INFINITY, the depth test is never applied.

attributes.name: distance-display-condition
attributes.description: `optional` The condition specifying at what distance from the camera that this label will be displayed.

attributes.name: eye-offset
attributes.description: `optional` The 3D Cartesian offset applied to this label in eye coordinates.

attributes.name: fill-color
attributes.description: `optional` The fill color of this label.

attributes.name: font
attributes.description: `optional`  The font used to draw this label. Fonts are specified using the same syntax as the CSS 'font' property.

attributes.name: height-reference
attributes.description: `optional` The height reference of this billboard. **NONE: 0, CLAMP_TO_GROUND: 1, RELATIVE_TO_GROUND: 2**

attributes.name: horizontal-origin
attributes.description: `optional` The horizontal origin of this label, which determines if the label is drawn to the left, center, or right of its anchor position. **CENTER: 0, LEFT: 1, RIGHT: -1**

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: `optional` The user-defined value returned when the label is picked.

attributes.name: outline-color
attributes.description: `optional` The outline color of this label.

attributes.name: outline-width
attributes.description: `optional` The outline width of this label.

attributes.name: pixel-offset
attributes.description: `optional` The pixel offset in screen space from the origin of this label.

attributes.name: pixel-offset-scale-by-distance
attributes.description: `optional` The near and far pixel offset scaling properties of a Label based on the Label's distance from the camera.

attributes.name: position
attributes.description: `optional` The position of this label.

attributes.name: scale
attributes.description: `optional` The uniform scale that is multiplied with the label's size in pixels.

attributes.name: scale-by-distance
attributes.description: `optional` The near and far scaling properties of a Label based on the label's distance from the camera.

attributes.name: show
attributes.description: `optional` Determines if this label will be shown. Use this to hide or show a label, instead of removing it and re-adding it to the collection.

attributes.name: show-background
attributes.description: `optional` Determines if a background behind this label will be shown.

attributes.name: label-style
attributes.description: `optional` The style of this label. **FILL: 0, OUTLINE: 1, FILL_AND_OUTLINE: 2**

attributes.name: text
attributes.description: `optional` The text of this label.

attributes.name: total-scale
attributes.description: `optional` The total scale of the label, which is the label's scale multiplied by the computed relative size of the desired font compared to the generated glyph size.

attributes.name: translucency-by-distance
attributes.description: `optional` The near and far translucency properties of a Label based on the Label's distance from the camera.

attributes.name: vertical-origin
attributes.description: `optional` The vertical origin of this label, which determines if the label is to the above, below, or at the center of its anchor position.**CENTER: 0, BOTTOM: 1, BASELINE: 2, TOP: -1**

attributes.description: `optional` Specify whether the mouse event takes effect.

tags.name: vc-primitive-model
tags.description: Loading a 3D model based on glTF, the runtime asset format for WebGL, OpenGL ES, and OpenGL. It is equivalent to initializing a `Cesium.Model` instance.

attributes.name: url
attributes.description: `required` The url to the .gltf file.

attributes.name: base-path
attributes.description: `optional` The base path that paths in the glTF JSON are relative to.

attributes.name: show
attributes.description: `optional` Determines if the model primitive will be shown.

attributes.name: model-matrix
attributes.description: `optional` The 4x4 transformation matrix that transforms the model from model to world coordinates.

attributes.name: scale
attributes.description: `optional` A uniform scale applied to this model.

attributes.name: minimum-pixel-size
attributes.description: `optional` The approximate minimum pixel size of the model regardless of zoom.

attributes.name: maximum-scale
attributes.description: `optional` The maximum scale for the model.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: `optional` A user-defined object to return when the model is picked with Scene#pick.

attributes.name: allow-picking
attributes.description: `optional` When true, each glTF mesh and primitive is pickable with Scene#pick.

attributes.name: incrementally-load-textures
attributes.description: `optional` Determine if textures may continue to stream in after the model is loaded.

attributes.name: asynchronous
attributes.description: `optional` Determines if model WebGL resource creation will be spread out over several frames or block until completion once all glTF files are loaded.

attributes.name: clamp-animations
attributes.description: `optional` Determines if the model's animations should hold a pose over frames where no keyframes are specified.

attributes.name: shadows
attributes.description: `optional` Determines whether the model casts or receives shadows from each light source. **DISABLED: 0, ENABLED: 1, CAST_ONLY: 2, RECEIVE_ONLY: 3**

attributes.name: debug-show-bounding-volume
attributes.description: `optional` For debugging only. Draws the bounding sphere for each DrawCommand in the model.

attributes.name: debug-wireframe
attributes.description: `optional` For debugging only. Draws the model in wireframe.

attributes.name: height-reference
attributes.description: `optional` Determines how the model is drawn relative to terrain. **NONE: 0, CLAMP_TO_GROUND: 1, RELATIVE_TO_GROUND: 2**

attributes.name: scene
attributes.description: `optional` Must be passed in for models that use the height reference property.

attributes.name: distance-display-condition
attributes.description: `optional` The condition specifying at what distance from the camera that this model will be displayed.

attributes.name: color
attributes.description: `optional` A color that blends with the model's rendered color.

attributes.name: color-blend-mode
attributes.description: `optional` Defines how the color blends with the model. **HIGHLIGHT: 0, REPLACE: 1, MIX: 2**

attributes.name: color-blend-amount
attributes.description: `optional` Value used to determine the color strength when the colorBlendMode is MIX. A value of 0.0 results in the model's rendered color while a value of 1.0 results in a solid color, with any value in-between resulting in a mix of the two.

attributes.name: silhouette-color
attributes.description: `optional` The silhouette color. If more than 256 models have silhouettes enabled, there is a small chance that overlapping models will have minor artifacts.

attributes.name: silhouette-size
attributes.description: `optional` The size of the silhouette in pixels.

attributes.name: clipping-planes
attributes.description: `optional` The ClippingPlaneCollection used to selectively disable rendering the model.

attributes.name: dequantize-in-shader
attributes.description: `optional` Determines if a Draco encoded model is dequantized on the GPU. This decreases total memory usage for encoded models.

attributes.name: image-based-lighting-factor
attributes.description: `optional` Scales diffuse and specular image-based lighting from the earth, sky, atmosphere and star skybox.

attributes.name: light-color
attributes.description: `optional` The light color when shading the model. When undefined the scene's light color is used instead.

attributes.name: luminance-at-zenith
attributes.description: `optional` The sun's luminance at the zenith in kilo candela per meter squared to use for this model's procedural environment map.

attributes.name: spherical-harmonic-coefficients
attributes.description: `optional` The third order spherical harmonic coefficients used for the diffuse color of image-based lighting.

attributes.name: specular-environment-maps
attributes.description: `optional` A URL to a KTX file that contains a cube map of the specular lighting and the convoluted specular mipmaps.

attributes.name: credit
attributes.description: `optional` A credit for the model, which is displayed on the canvas.

attributes.name: back-face-culling
attributes.description: `optional` Whether to cull back-facing geometry. When true, back face culling is determined by the material's doubleSided property; when false, back face culling is disabled. Back faces are not culled if Model#color is translucent or Model#silhouetteSize is greater than 0.0.

attributes.description: `optional` Specify whether the mouse event takes effect.

tags.name: vc-primitive-particle
tags.description: Loading a ParticleSystem manages the updating and display of a collection of particles. It is equivalent to initializing a `Cesium.ParticleSystem` instance.

attributes.name: show
attributes.description: `optional`Whether to display the particle system.

attributes.name: update-callback
attributes.description: `optional` The callback function to be called each frame to update a particle.

attributes.name: emitter
attributes.description: `optional` The particle emitter for this system.

attributes.name: model-matrix
attributes.description: `optional` The 4x4 transformation matrix that transforms the particle system from model to world coordinates.

attributes.name: emitter-model-matrix
attributes.description: `optional` The 4x4 transformation matrix that transforms the particle system emitter within the particle systems local coordinate system.

attributes.name: emission-rate
attributes.description: `optional` The number of particles to emit per second.

attributes.name: bursts
attributes.description: `optional` An array of [ParticleBurst](https://cesium.com/docs/cesiumjs-ref-doc/ParticleBurst.html), emitting bursts of particles at periodic times.

attributes.name: loop
attributes.description: `optional` Whether the particle system should loop its bursts when it is complete.

attributes.name: scale
attributes.description: `optional` Sets the scale to apply to the image of the particle for the duration of its particleLife.

attributes.name: start-scale
attributes.description: `optional` The final scale to apply to the image of the particle at the end of its life.

attributes.name: end-scale
attributes.description: `optional` Sets the color of a particle for the duration of its particleLife.

attributes.name: color
attributes.description: `optional` Sets the color of a particle for the duration of its particleLife.

attributes.name: start-color
attributes.description: `optional` The color of the particle at the beginning of its life.

attributes.name: end-color
attributes.description: `optional` The color of the particle at the end of its life.

attributes.name: image
attributes.description: `optional` The URI, HTMLImageElement, or HTMLCanvasElement to use for the billboard.

attributes.name: image-size
attributes.description: `optional` If set, overrides the minimumImageSize and maximumImageSize inputs that scale the particle image's dimensions in pixels.

attributes.name: minimum-image-size
attributes.description: `optional` Sets the minimum bound, width by height, above which to randomly scale the particle image's dimensions in pixels.

attributes.name: maximum-image-size
attributes.description: `optional` Sets the maximum bound, width by height, below which to randomly scale the particle image's dimensions in pixels.

attributes.name: speed
attributes.description: `optional` If set, overrides the minimumSpeed and maximumSpeed inputs with this value.

attributes.name: minimum-speed
attributes.description: `optional` Sets the minimum bound in meters per second above which a particle's actual speed will be randomly chosen.

attributes.name: maximum-speed
attributes.description: `optional` Sets the maximum bound in meters per second below which a particle's actual speed will be randomly chosen.

attributes.name: lifetime
attributes.description: `optional` How long the particle system will emit particles, in seconds.

attributes.name: particle-life
attributes.description: `optional` If set, overrides the minimumParticleLife and maximumParticleLife inputs with this value.

attributes.name: minimum-particle-life
attributes.description: `optional` Sets the minimum bound in seconds for the possible duration of a particle's life above which a particle's actual life will be randomly chosen.

attributes.name: maximum-particle-life
attributes.description: `optional` Sets the maximum bound in seconds for the possible duration of a particle's life below which a particle's actual life will be randomly chosen.

attributes.name: mass
attributes.description: `optional` Sets the minimum and maximum mass of particles in kilograms.

attributes.name: minimum-mass
attributes.description: `optional` Sets the minimum bound for the mass of a particle in kilograms. A particle's actual mass will be chosen as a random amount above this value.

attributes.name: maximum-mass
attributes.description: `optional` Sets the maximum mass of particles in kilograms. A particle's actual mass will be chosen as a random amount below this value.

attributes.description: `optional` Specify whether the mouse event takes effect.

tags.name: vc-primitive-tileset
tags.description: Loading a 3D Tiles tileset, used for streaming massive heterogeneous 3D geospatial datasets. It is equivalent to initializing a `Cesium.Cesium3DTileset` instance.

attributes.name: url
attributes.description: `required` The url to a tileset JSON file.

attributes.name: show
attributes.description: `optional` Determines if the tileset will be shown.

attributes.name: model-matrix
attributes.description: `optional` A 4x4 transformation matrix that transforms the tileset's root tile.

attributes.name: shadows
attributes.description: `optional` Determines whether the tileset casts or receives shadows from light sources. **DISABLED: 0, ENABLED: 1, CAST_ONLY: 2, RECEIVE_ONLY: 3**

attributes.name: maximum-screen-space-error
attributes.description: `optional` The maximum screen space error used to drive level of detail refinement.

attributes.name: maximum-memory-usage
attributes.description: `optional` The maximum amount of memory in MB that can be used by the tileset.

attributes.name: cull-with-children-bounds
attributes.description: `optional` Optimization option. Whether to cull tiles using the union of their children bounding volumes.

attributes.name: cull-requests-while-moving
attributes.description: `optional` Optimization option. Don't request tiles that will likely be unused when they come back because of the camera's movement. This optimization only applies to stationary tilesets.

attributes.name: cull-requests-while-moving-multiplier
attributes.description: `optional` Optimization option. Multiplier used in culling requests while moving. Larger is more aggressive culling, smaller less aggressive culling.

attributes.name: preload-when-hidden
attributes.description: `optional` Preload tiles when tileset.show is false. Loads tiles as if the tileset is visible but does not render them.

attributes.name: preload-flight-destinations
attributes.description: `optional` Optimization option. Preload tiles at the camera's flight destination while the camera is in flight.

attributes.name: prefer-leaves
attributes.description: `optional` Optimization option. Prefer loading of leaves first.

attributes.name: dynamic-screen-space-error
attributes.description: `optional` Optimization option. Reduce the screen space error for tiles that are further away from the camera.

attributes.name: dynamic-screen-space-error-density
attributes.description: `optional` Density used to adjust the dynamic screen space error, similar to fog density.

attributes.name: dynamic-screen-space-error-factor
attributes.description: `optional` A factor used to increase the computed dynamic screen space error.

attributes.name: dynamic-screen-space-error-height-falloff
attributes.description: `optional` A ratio of the tileset's height at which the density starts to falloff.

attributes.name: progressive-resolution-height-fraction
attributes.description: `optional` Optimization option. If between (0.0, 0.5], tiles at or above the screen space error for the reduced screen resolution of progressiveResolutionHeightFraction*screenHeight will be prioritized first. This can help get a quick layer of tiles down while full resolution tiles continue to load.

attributes.name: foveated-screen-space-error
attributes.description: `optional` Optimization option. Prioritize loading tiles in the center of the screen by temporarily raising the screen space error for tiles around the edge of the screen. Screen space error returns to normal once all the tiles in the center of the screen as determined by the Cesium3DTileset#foveatedConeSize are loaded.

attributes.name: foveated-cone-size
attributes.description: `optional` Optimization option. Used when Cesium3DTileset#foveatedScreenSpaceError is true to control the cone size that determines which tiles are deferred. Tiles that are inside this cone are loaded immediately. Tiles outside the cone are potentially deferred based on how far outside the cone they are and their screen space error. This is controlled by Cesium3DTileset#foveatedInterpolationCallback and Cesium3DTileset#foveatedMinimumScreenSpaceErrorRelaxation. Setting this to 0.0 means the cone will be the line formed by the camera position and its view direction. Setting this to 1.0 means the cone encompasses the entire field of view of the camera, disabling the effect.

attributes.name: foveated-minimum-screen-space-error-relaxation
attributes.description: `optional` Optimization option. Used when Cesium3DTileset#foveatedScreenSpaceError is true to control the starting screen space error relaxation for tiles outside the foveated cone. The screen space error will be raised starting with tileset value up to Cesium3DTileset#maximumScreenSpaceError based on the provided Cesium3DTileset#foveatedInterpolationCallback.

attributes.name: foveated-interpolation-callback
attributes.description: `optional` Optimization option. Used when Cesium3DTileset#foveatedScreenSpaceError is true to control how much to raise the screen space error for tiles outside the foveated cone, interpolating between Cesium3DTileset#foveatedMinimumScreenSpaceErrorRelaxation and Cesium3DTileset#maximumScreenSpaceError

attributes.name: foveated-time-delay
attributes.description: `optional` Optimization option. Used when Cesium3DTileset#foveatedScreenSpaceError is true to control how long in seconds to wait after the camera stops moving before deferred tiles start loading in. This time delay prevents requesting tiles around the edges of the screen when the camera is moving. Setting this to 0.0 will immediately request all tiles in any given view.

attributes.name: skip-level-of-detail
attributes.description: `optional` Optimization option. Determines if level of detail skipping should be applied during the traversal.

attributes.name: base-screen-space-error
attributes.description: `optional` When skipLevelOfDetail is true, the screen space error that must be reached before skipping levels of detail.

attributes.name: skip-screen-space-error-factor
attributes.description: `optional` When skipLevelOfDetail is true, a multiplier defining the minimum screen space error to skip. Used in conjunction with skipLevels to determine which tiles to load.

attributes.name: skip-levels
attributes.description: `optional` When skipLevelOfDetail is true, a constant defining the minimum number of levels to skip when loading tiles. When it is 0, no levels are skipped. Used in conjunction with skipScreenSpaceErrorFactor to determine which tiles to load.

attributes.name: immediately-load-desired-level-of-detail
attributes.description: `optional` When skipLevelOfDetail is true, only tiles that meet the maximum screen space error will ever be downloaded. Skipping factors are ignored and just the desired tiles are loaded.

attributes.name: load-siblings
attributes.description: `optional` When skipLevelOfDetail is true, determines whether siblings of visible tiles are always downloaded during traversal.

attributes.name: clipping-planes
attributes.description: `optional` The ClippingPlaneCollection used to selectively disable rendering the tileset.

attributes.name: classification-type
attributes.description: `optional` Determines whether terrain, 3D Tiles or both will be classified by this tileset. See Cesium3DTileset#classificationType for details about restrictions and limitations. **TERRAIN: 0, CESIUM_3D_TILE: 1, BOTH: 2**

attributes.name: ellipsoid
attributes.description: `optional` The ellipsoid determining the size and shape of the globe.

attributes.name: point-cloud-shading
attributes.description: `optional` Options for constructing a PointCloudShading object to control point attenuation based on geometric error and lighting.

attributes.name: image-based-lighting-factor
attributes.description: `optional` Scales the diffuse and specular image-based lighting from the earth, sky, atmosphere and star skybox.

attributes.name: light-color
attributes.description: `optional` The light color when shading models. When undefined the scene's light color is used instead.

attributes.name: luminance-at-zenith
attributes.description: `optional` The sun's luminance at the zenith in kilo candela per meter squared to use for this model's procedural environment map.

attributes.name: spherical-harmonic-coefficients
attributes.description: `optional` The third order spherical harmonic coefficients used for the diffuse color of image-based lighting.

attributes.name: specular-environment-maps
attributes.description: `optional` A URL to a KTX file that contains a cube map of the specular lighting and the convoluted specular mipmaps.

attributes.name: back-face-culling
attributes.description: `optional`Whether to cull back-facing geometry. When true, back face culling is determined by the glTF material's doubleSided property; when false, back face culling is disabled.

attributes.name: show-outline
attributes.description: `optional`Whether to display the outline for models using the CESIUM_primitive_outline extension. When true, outlines are displayed. When false, outlines are not displayed.

attributes.name: vector-keep-decoded-positions
attributes.description: `optional`Whether vector tiles should keep decoded positions in memory. This is used with Cesium3DTileFeature.getPolylinePositions.

attributes.name: vector-classification-only
attributes.description: `optional` Indicates that only the tileset's vector tiles should be used for classification.

attributes.name: debug-heatmap-tile-property-name
attributes.description: `optional` The tile variable to colorize as a heatmap. All rendered tiles will be colorized relative to each other's specified variable value.

attributes.name: debug-freeze-frame
attributes.description: `optional` For debugging only. Determines if only the tiles from last frame should be used for rendering.

attributes.name: debug-colorize-tiles
attributes.description: `optional` For debugging only. When true, assigns a random color to each tile.

attributes.name: debug-wireframe
attributes.description: `optional` For debugging only. When true, render's each tile's content as a wireframe.

attributes.name: debug-show-bounding-volume
attributes.description: `optional` For debugging only. When true, renders the bounding volume for each tile.

attributes.name: debug-show-content-bounding-volume
attributes.description: `optional` For debugging only. When true, renders the bounding volume for each tile's content.

attributes.name: debug-show-viewer-request-volume
attributes.description: `optional` For debugging only. When true, renders the viewer request volume for each tile.

attributes.name: debug-show-geometric-error
attributes.description: `optional` For debugging only. When true, draws labels to indicate the geometric error of each tile.

attributes.name: debug-show-rendering-statistics
attributes.description: `optional` For debugging only. When true, draws labels to indicate the number of commands, points, triangles and features for each tile.

attributes.name: debug-show-memory-usage
attributes.description: `optional` For debugging only. When true, draws labels to indicate the texture and geometry memory in megabytes used by each tile.

attributes.name: debug-show-url
attributes.description: `optional` For debugging only. When true, draws labels to indicate the url of each tile.

attributes.name: enable-mouse-event
attributes.description: `optional` Specify whether the mouse event takes effect.

tags.name: vc-primitive
tags.description: Loading a geometry of primitive, the geometry can be from a single `GeometryInstance` or from an array of instances, or `vc-geometry-xxx` component. It is equivalent to initializing a `Cesium.Primitive` instance.

attributes.name: geometry-instances
attributes.description: `optional` The geometry instances - or a single geometry instance - to render.

attributes.name: appearance
attributes.description: `optional` The appearance used to render the primitive.

attributes.name: depth-fail-appearance
attributes.description: `optional` The appearance used to shade this primitive when it fails the depth test.

attributes.name: show
attributes.description: `optional` Determines if this primitive will be shown.

attributes.name: model-matrix
attributes.description: `optional` The 4x4 transformation matrix that transforms the primitive (all geometry instances) from model to world coordinates.

attributes.name: vertex-cache-optimize
attributes.description: `optional` When true, geometry vertices are optimized for the pre and post-vertex-shader caches.

attributes.name: interleave
attributes.description: `optional` When true, geometry vertex attributes are interleaved, which can slightly improve rendering performance but increases load time.

attributes.name: compress-vertices
attributes.description: `optional` When true, the geometry vertices are compressed, which will save memory.

attributes.name: release-geometry-instances
attributes.description: `optional` When true, the primitive does not keep a reference to the input geometryInstances to save memory.

attributes.name: allow-picking
attributes.description: `optional` When true, each geometry instance will only be pickable with Scene#pick. When false, GPU memory is saved.

attributes.name: cull
attributes.description: `optional` When true, the renderer frustum culls and horizon culls the primitive's commands based on their bounding volume. Set this to false for a small performance gain if you are manually culling the primitive.

attributes.name: asynchronous
attributes.description: `optional` Determines if the primitive will be created asynchronously or block until ready.

attributes.name: debug-show-bounding-volume
attributes.description: `optional` For debugging only. Determines if this primitive's commands' bounding spheres are shown.

attributes.name: shadows
attributes.description: `optional` Determines whether this primitive casts or receives shadows from each light source. **DISABLED: 0, ENABLED: 1, CAST_ONLY: 2, RECEIVE_ONLY: 3**

attributes.name: enable-mouse-event
attributes.description: `optional` Specify whether the mouse event takes effect.

tags.name: vc-imagery-provider-arcgis
tags.description: Loading a tiled imagery provider that provides tiled imagery hosted by an ArcGIS MapServer. It is equivalent to initializing a `Cesium.ArcGisMapServerImageryProvider` instance.

attributes.name: url
attributes.description: `optional` The URL of the ArcGIS MapServer service.

attributes.name: token
attributes.description: `optional` The ArcGIS token used to authenticate with the ArcGIS MapServer service.

attributes.name: tile-discard-policy
attributes.description: `optional` The policy that determines if a tile is invalid and should be discarded.

attributes.name: use-pre-cached-tiles-if-available
attributes.description: `optional` If true, the server's pre-cached tiles are used if they are available. If false, any pre-cached tiles are ignored and the 'export' service is used.

attributes.name: layers
attributes.description: `optional` A comma-separated list of the layers to show, or undefined if all layers should be shown.

attributes.name: enable-pick-features
attributes.description: `optional` If true, ArcGisMapServerImageryProvider#pickFeatures will invoke the Identify service on the MapServer and return the features included in the response. If false, ArcGisMapServerImageryProvider#pickFeatures will immediately return undefined (indicating no pickable features) without communicating with the server. Set this property to false if you don't want this provider's features to be pickable. Can be overridden by setting the ArcGisMapServerImageryProvider#enablePickFeatures property on the object.

attributes.name: rectangle
attributes.description: `optional` The rectangle of the layer. This rectangle can limit the visible portion of the imagery provider.

attributes.name: tiling-scheme
attributes.description: `optional` The tiling scheme to use to divide the world into tiles. This parameter is ignored when accessing a tiled server.

attributes.name: ellipsoid
attributes.description: `optional` The ellipsoid. If the tilingScheme is specified and used, this parameter is ignored and the tiling scheme's ellipsoid is used instead. If neither parameter is specified, the WGS84 ellipsoid is used.

attributes.name: credit
attributes.description: `optional` A credit for the data source, which is displayed on the canvas. This parameter is ignored when accessing a tiled server.

attributes.name: tile-width
attributes.description: `optional` The width of each tile in pixels. This parameter is ignored when accessing a tiled server.

attributes.name: tile-height
attributes.description: `optional` The height of each tile in pixels. This parameter is ignored when accessing a tiled server.

attributes.name: maximum-level
attributes.description: `optional` The maximum tile level to request, or undefined if there is no maximum. This parameter is ignored when accessing a tiled server.

tags.name: vc-imagery-provider-bing
tags.description: Loading a tiled imagery provider using the Bing Maps Imagery REST API. It is equivalent to initializing a `Cesium.BingMapsImageryProvider` instance.

attributes.name: url
attributes.description: `required` The url of the Bing Maps server hosting the imagery.

attributes.name: bm-key
attributes.description: `optional` The Bing Maps key for your application, which can be created at [https://www.bingmapsportal.com/](https://www.bingmapsportal.com/). **Note that it is bmKey**

attributes.name: tile-protocol
attributes.description: `optional` The protocol to use when loading tiles, e.g. 'http:' or 'https:'. By default, tiles are loaded using the same protocol as the page.

attributes.name: map-style
attributes.description: `optional` The type of Bing Maps imagery to load.

attributes.name: culture
attributes.description: `optional` The culture to use when requesting Bing Maps imagery. Not all cultures are supported. See http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh441729.aspx for information on the supported cultures.

attributes.name: ellipsoid
attributes.description: `optional` The ellipsoid. If not specified, the WGS84 ellipsoid is used.

attributes.name: tile-discard-policy
attributes.description: `optional` The policy that determines if a tile is invalid and should be discarded. By default, a DiscardEmptyTileImagePolicy will be used, with the expectation that the Bing Maps server will send a zero-length response for missing tiles. To ensure that no tiles are discarded, construct and pass a NeverTileDiscardPolicy for this parameter.
